key_points: Twitter permanently suspended the MyPillow USA account for violating its ban evasion policy.
The suspension followed a week after MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell's personal account was banned.
Lindell, a Trump supporter, has been vocal about his beliefs that the presidential election was rigged.
Cached tweets show Lindell used the MyPillow account to circumvent his personal suspension.
Lindell expressed disbelief over the suspension, stating it was an attempt to destroy him.
Tweets from the MyPillow account accused Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey of being involved in election fraud.
Twitter's evasion policy prohibits suspended users from operating other accounts to circumvent the ban.
Several retailers, including Kohl's, Bed Bath & Beyond, and J.C. Penney, have ceased selling MyPillow products due to sales slowdown.
Dominion Voting Systems is considering litigation against Lindell for his claims about their machines and election fraud.
Twitter has banned over 70,000 accounts for misinformation after the U.S. Capitol storming, including Donald Trump's account.
